funfacts.fact: 740 plastic bottles are bought in Japan every second.
More than 8 million tons of plastic are dumped into our oceans every year.
Approximately 2 million plastic bags are used every minute around the world.
The average plastic bag is used for only 12 minutes!
Global plastic production has doubled in the past 50 years.
It's estimated that 50% of the plastic we consume is used just once and thrown away.
Approximately 90 percent of all trash floating on the ocean's surface is plastic, with 46,000 pieces of plastic per square mile.
There are over 5 trillion pieces of plastic in our oceans â€“ enough to circle the Earth over 400 times.
Japan is the world's second-biggest producer per capita of plastic waste behind the U.S.
Over 25 billion PET bottle products are produced every year in Japan, equal to approximately 180 bottles per person.
By 2050, it is estimated that there will be more plastic than fish in the sea.
